Adjust height on machine so that handles are at chest height when seated
Make sure you are seated so that your back is straight and against the pad. Feet flat on the floor.
Select weight by taking the pin out of the weight section and inserting it into the weight you want. TIP: Start with a low weight and build upwards if too easy
Grip the handles with palms facing downwards and push forward whilst exhaling. Try not to lock your elbows
Slowly bend elbows to return to start position whilst inhaling. Make sure not to let the weight stack to slam back down.
You have completed one rep. Repeat until you have finished set (Recommend 8-12 reps)
Stand on machine and familiarise yourself with the control panel. Different treadmills may have different buttons and layouts
When you are ready press the start button. This will start you off at a slow walking pace
Slowly increase the speed by pressing the increase speed button (may be shown as arrows labelled as Speed) until you are happy with the speed. Decrease speed when needed
You can also change the incline of the machine to simulate a hill (may be shown as arrows labelled as Incline)
Once you have finished you can either press the stop button or you can press the cooldown button that will slow the treadmill down to a walk before eventually stopping (Recommended)
Sprints can be used for weight loss. It can be used as part of HIIT (High Intensity Interval Training).
To do sprints on the treadmill you can sprint for 30 seconds by increasing the speed and then resting for a minute by reducing speed to a slow walk. Change rest times accordnign to fitness levels
Try to keep your heart rate above 70 percent of your maximum heart rate (220-age) at all times. When sprinting heart rate should be at 80 percent or 90 percent
This type of cardio increases metabolism for the rest of the day
Using the treadmill for long periods of time at a comfortable pace can help your fitness and stamina as a whole
Find a speed that you can maintain for long periods of time. For example at least 20 minutes
Keep your heart rate at about 60% to 80%
Adjust seat height so that you are in a comfortable position with Triceps on the pads and hands on the handles
Once you have correct position, choose your weight. Try lower weights first and up the weight later if it is too easy
Hold the handles with your palms facing up, your arms resting on the pads, and your elbows near to the edge of the pads
Now, flex your elbows and pull the handles towards you until you cant go any further. Pause and then slowly return arms back to start
Make sure the moving weight stack does not hit the resting weight stack
You have completed one rep. Repeat until you have finished set (Recommend 8-12 reps). Then take a rest and do a few more sets. (Recommended 3 sets)
Do you consent to this app getting your heartrate?
Add you current Weight in kg and press Add button
